label: Monument where St. Edmund fell
column7: was captured by the Danes in 870 after refusing to renounce his Christian faith. He was tied to an oak tree
column10: and beheaded—his head later miraculously found guarded by a wolf.

label: St Levan Stone
column5: It is said that this was St. Levan's favourite seat; and one day cracked it in two with a blow from his staff and uttered a prophecy.

longitude: -0.6772717 Saint Etheldreda's Staff https://lincolnshirefolktalesproject.com/2025/01/08/saint-etheldredas-staff St. Etheldreda is said to have paused at Stow while fleeing to become a nun
label: where she planted her staff and it miraculously blossomed into a full tree that sheltered her. A church was then believed to have been founded on the spot in memory of the miracle — a story still depicted in stained glass in Stow Minster. #saint#attrib
